text:
Hey everyone ! I'm quite new to versionning and releases on Github and I'm having some issues when using a Github Actions deployment of my docs.

When I created the first release on github, my Github Actions bot does the job and everything works fine. The gh-page branch is created, with a stable and a v1.0. When added some commit to master, it generates the dev page perfectly.

But when I try to add a second release called v1.1, I'm getting the following error :
From <https://github.com/jrmbr/MyPackage.jl>
 * [new branch]      gh-pages   -> upstream/gh-pages
 * [new branch]      master     -> upstream/master
 * [new tag]         v1.1       -> v1.1
 * [new tag]         v1.0       -> v1.0
Switched to a new branch 'gh-pages'

Branch 'gh-pages' set up to track remote branch 'gh-pages' from 'upstream'.
┌ Error: Failed to push:
│   exception =
│    ArgumentError: link `"v1" => "v1.1"` incompatible with link `"v1.0" => "v1"`.

elements.text:
Hey everyone ! I'm quite new to versionning and releases on Github and I'm having some issues when using a Github Actions deployment of my docs.

When I created the first release on github, my Github Actions bot does the job and everything works fine. The gh-page branch is created, with a stable and a v1.0. When added some commit to master, it generates the dev page perfectly.

But when I try to add a second release called v1.1, I'm getting the following error :
From

* [new branch]      gh-pages   -> upstream/gh-pages
 * [new branch]      master     -> upstream/master
 * [new tag]         v1.1       -> v1.1
 * [new tag]         v1.0       -> v1.0
Switched to a new branch 'gh-pages'

Branch 'gh-pages' set up to track remote branch 'gh-pages' from 'upstream'.
┌ Error: Failed to push:
│   exception =
│    ArgumentError: link `"v1" => "v1.1"` incompatible with link `"v1.0" => "v1"`.

text: what is the issue? (feel free to link directly to the failing action/repo)

elements.text: what is the issue? (feel free to link directly to the failing action/repo)

text: repo does not exist. is it private?

elements.text: repo does not exist. is it private?

text: Yes
I'm making some tests as I'm quite new to all of this :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: I'm making some tests as I'm quite new to all of this

text: I'm using a self hosted runner for the github action, I don't know if that might be relevant

elements.text: I'm using a self hosted runner for the github action, I don't know if that might be relevant

text: I can switch to public if needed !

elements.text: I can switch to public if needed !

text:
So the linking issue might be due to accidentally malformed releases

I don’t know _why_ documenter fails here, but basically you’re not including the patch number in your release versions

IE you are releasing `v1.1` instead of `v1.1.0`, which I’m going to guess is causing the failures

elements.text:
So the linking issue might be due to accidentally malformed releases

I don’t know

documenter fails here, but basically you’re not including the patch number in your release versions

IE you are releasing
, which I’m going to guess is causing the failures

text: Ok, but it is not an issue for the first release ?

elements.text: Ok, but it is not an issue for the first release ?

text: on the first release documenter created a punch of symlinks on your `gh-pages` branch, but none existed before so it couldn’t have errored.

elements.text: on the first release documenter created a punch of symlinks on your
branch, but none existed before so it couldn’t have errored.

text:
Ok thanks ! Also I'm not quite sure how to cofigure the github actions when using a self hosted runner. Currently, my yml file is the following:

`# This is a basic workflow to help you get started with Actions`

`name: Documentation`

`# Controls when the action will run. Triggers the workflow on push or pull request`
`# events but only for the master branch`
`on:`
  `push:`
    `branches: [ master ]`
    `tags: ['*']`
  `pull_request:`

`# A workflow run is made up of one or more jobs that can run sequentially or in parallel`
`jobs:`
  `# This workflow contains a single job called "build"`
  `build:`
    `# The type of runner that the job will run on`
    `runs-on: self-hosted`

    `# Steps represent a sequence of tasks that will be executed as part of the job`
    `steps:`
      `# Checks-out your repository under $GITHUB_WORKSPACE, so your job can access it`
      `- uses: actions/checkout@v2`

      `# Runs a set of commands using the runners shell`
      `- name: Build and deploy`
        `env:`
          `DOCUMENTER_DEBUG: true`
          `GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN}}`
        `run:` 
          `julia --project=docs/ docs/make.jl`

Could you tell me if I made an obvious mistake here ?

text:
it’s no different than cloning a repository and doing the manual command line tasks of renaming folders and changing names of symlinks,

the symlinks are probably broken because of the versioning issues. here’s an example of a “normal” docs branch <https://github.com/JuliaAstro/PSFModels.jl/tree/gh-pages> (symlinked folders have an arrow on them)
